clinical_study.brief_title: Perception of Stressful Social Stimuli in Posttraumatic Stress Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Predictive Value of Abnormal Perception of Stressful Social Stimuli for the Course of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is associated with altered processing of sensory stimuli. The clinical phenotype of PTSD has predominantly been described for the visual and auditory sensory modalities. However, PTSD symptoms such as intrusive memories are often evoked by olfactory and tactile cues in the environment. The purpose of this study is to compare trauma-exposed subjects who developed PTSD and trauma-exposed subjects who did not develop PTSD with non-exposed controls in the processing of olfactory and tactile stimuli. This sensory characterizations hold potential to identify potential biomarkers for the course of PTSD and to inform trauma therapies focusing on sensory integration.

primary_outcome.measure: Emotion recognition ratings obtained during a forced-choice emotional face recognition task with stimuli of varying intensities (neutral to fearful).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Ratings will be assessed throughout fMRI scanning over the course of 25 minutes.

primary_outcome.measure: Neural substrates of social tactile stimuli processing.
primary_outcome.time_frame: The neural substrates will be assessed througout fMRI scanning over the course of 20 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: fMRI scanning will be used to measure neural respones to tactile stimuli.

primary_outcome.measure: Valence ratings of social tactile stimuli.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Ratings will be assessed throughout fMRI scanning over the course of 20 minutes.

primary_outcome.measure: Neural substrates of social olfactory stimuli processing.
primary_outcome.time_frame: The neural substrates will be assessed througout fMRI scanning over the course of 25 minutes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The oxytocin plasma concentrations of all participants will be assessed 15 minutes before fMRI scanning onset..

secondary_outcome.measure: Olfactory performance in a n-butanol odor staircase threshold test.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The olfactory threshold of all participants will be assessed in a screening session at least 24 hours prior to fMRI scanning.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants' olfactory performance will be assessed by administering the 'Sniffin' Sticks' test, which measures nasal chemosensory performance based on pen-like odor dispensing devices.

study_pop.textblock: The study population will consist of patients with posttraumatic stress disorder, trauma-exposed healthy controls and healthy controls without trauma-exposure. In the planed study, the trauma type of all subjects will be assessed and participants with intentional and accidental trauma will be compared. Patients and healthy controls will be recruited from the Bonn area.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Subjects that have experienced a traumatic event that meets the DSM-5 criteria
- Subjects of the PTSD group: PTSD-7 scale scores ≥ 4
- Subjects of the PTSD group: meeting the DSM-5 criteria for PTSD
Exclusion Criteria:
- Schizophrenia, schizoaffective or other psychotic disorder
- Neurological disorders
- Psychotropic medication
- Subjects suffering from a respiratory tract infection or other respiratory disorder known to affect olfactory functioning at investigator's discretion
- Subjects with anosmia or other previous primary olfactory dysfunction (olfactory threshold score using the "Sniffin' Sticks" ≤ 5)
- Dermatitis of the extremities or other skin disorders that affect the skin sensitivity of the extremities
